quiz.instructions: Choose the best answer for each question.

questions.question: What are options?
options: Mandatory contracts to buy or sell stocks
Derivative contracts giving you the right, but not obligation, to buy or sell an asset
questions.explanation: Options are derivative contracts that give you the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell an underlying asset at a predetermined price before a specific date.

questions.question: When would an investor buy a call option?
options: When they believe a stock will decline
When they believe a stock will rise significantly
When they want to avoid all risk
questions.explanation: Investors buy calls when they believe a stock will rise significantly, giving them the right to buy at a lower strike price.

questions.question: In the example given, if you buy a $55 strike call for $2 and the stock rises to $65, what is your net profit?
questions.explanation: You make $10 per share ($65 - $55) Ã— 100 shares = $1,000, minus the $200 premium paid = $800 net profit (a 400% return).

questions.question: What happens if an option expires out of the money?
options: You can extend the expiration date
The option expires worthless and you lose your entire investment
questions.explanation: If the stock stays at or below the strike price for a call (or above for a put), your option expires worthless and you lose your entire premium investment.

questions.question: What is theta in options trading?
options: Time decay - options lose value as expiration approaches
questions.explanation: Theta represents time decay, meaning options lose value as expiration approaches, even if the stock doesn't move.

questions.question: When would an investor buy a put option?
options: When they expect a stock to rise
When they expect a stock to decline
questions.explanation: A put option gives you the right to sell shares at the strike price, so investors buy puts when they expect a stock to decline.

questions.question: How many shares does one standard options contract control?
questions.explanation: Options contracts control 100 shares, which is why the premium is multiplied by 100 to get the total cost.

questions.question: What are the three main uses of options mentioned?
options: Day trading, swing trading, and position trading
questions.explanation: Options can be used for speculation (betting on price direction), hedging (protecting existing positions), or income generation (selling options to collect premium).

questions.question: Why do many retail traders lose money on options?
options: They underestimate time decay and volatility changes, or treat them like lottery tickets
questions.explanation: Many retail traders lose money because they underestimate the impact of time decay and volatility changes, or they treat options like lottery tickets rather than calculated risks.

questions.question: What do most financial advisors recommend before trading options?
options: Master stock investing thoroughly first, then start with simple strategies and small positions
Only trade options with borrowed money
questions.explanation: Most financial advisors recommend beginners master stock investing thoroughly before touching options, and even then, starting with simple strategies and small positions.
